description: Four-part ongoing assessment using MATLAB/Python to solve computational problems in finance, with instant feedback via MATLAB Grader or similar tools. Tests synthesis of mathematical theory and practical computation.
90-minute individual programming test under exam conditions (Week 9). Requires writing scripts/functions in MATLAB/Python to solve simplified lab exercise problems.
2-hour individual exam testing mathematical understanding of numerical methods and their financial applications. Covers entire course content during formal exam period.
